title: Putin Talks About Russia's War Goals in Ukraine
summary: Russian President Vladimir Putin spoke at a big news conference. He said that Russia's military is doing well in Ukraine and moving forward in many places. Putin believes Russia will win the war if Ukraine does not agree to Russia's peace terms. He mentioned that Russia wants to keep control of areas it has taken, like Crimea and four other regions. Putin also said Ukraine should not join NATO, a group of countries that work together for defense. The news conference was planned carefully to show Putin's power and talk about the war. He praised U.S. President Donald Trump for trying to make peace but did not give details. Ukraine has said no to Russia's demands. The war has been going on for almost four years.

background_read: Russia and Ukraine have been in a war since 2022. Russia invaded Ukraine, and many countries have tried to help Ukraine. Putin is the president of Russia and has been in power for a long time. The news conference is an event where Putin answers questions from people in Russia. The war has caused a lot of damage and people are suffering. Peace talks are discussions to try to end the war, but they are hard because both sides want different things.
Article_Structure: WHAT: He said Russia's military is advancing in Ukraine and will win if Ukraine doesn't accept peace terms
WHERE: In Moscow, at an annual news conference
WHY: To show Russia's strength and push for its demands in the war

perspectives.description: Putin believes Russia is winning and wants peace on its terms to keep control of areas like Crimea.
